sen.j: 740年に伊勢国に行幸する聖武天皇に付き従った。
sen.e: In 740, he accompanied Emperor Shomu on his imperial sojourn to Iga Province.

sen.j: 村国氏は美濃国各務郡の豪族で、村国男依が672年の壬申の乱で功を立てたことにより、朝廷でも知られるようになった。
sen.e: The Murakuni clan was the most powerful local family in the Kakami district of Mino Province, and thanks to MURAKUNI no Oyori winning distinction in the fighting during the Jinshin War (of 672), their fame appears to have grown enough to be known to the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 子虫はその係累と思われるが、系譜は不明である。
sen.e: Komushi is thought to have been a descendant of Oyori's, but his actual genealogy remains unknown.

sen.j: 天平11年（739年）1月に、子虫は正六位上から外従五位下に昇った。
sen.e: In the first month of 739, Komushi was promoted from senior sixth rank, upper grade to junior fifth rank, lower grade.
In the first month of 739, Komushi was promoted from Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) to Ge-jugoinoge (Jugoinoge [Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade] given to persons outside Kyoto).

sen.j: その前に現れる村国氏の官人としては、男依の子村国志我麻呂がおり、天平3年（731年）に従五位上になったのを最後に『続日本紀』の記録がなくなる。
sen.e: One other member of the Murakuni clan, namely Oyori's son MURAKUNI no Shigamaro, was also a court official and appears before Komushi in the historical sources; the final mention of Shigamaro is an article in the "Shoku Nihongi" which notes that he was promoted to junior fifth rank, senior grade in 731.

sen.e: In 740, in the middle of FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu's Revolt, Emperor Shomu suddenly made an imperial sojourn to Iga Province.

sen.j: 村国連子虫はこれに従い、11月21日に発せられた陪従者の昇叙に連なって外従五位下に昇った。
sen.e: MURAKUNI no Komushi, in his role as Companion, accompanied the Emperor, and separately from the promotions given out to the Emperor's attendants on the occasion of the Emperor's departure on the 21st day of the eleventh month, Komushi was promoted to junior fifth rank, lower grade.
